cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: tracking WNW across the southern coast of Cuba, then turning northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the Texas-Louisiana coastline before recurving inland toward Arkansas/Missouri
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas-Louisiana border along the U.S. Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect for the Florida Keys from Craig Key to Key West
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings for much of Cuba, Little Cayman, Cayman Brac, and the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impact expected along the Texas-Louisiana Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Remnant system could bring gusty winds of 25–35 mph as it passes nearby on 28–29 Aug.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–3 inches of rain possible, creating localized flooding along the Missouri River and tributaries
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential river level rises and minor flooding could disrupt barge traffic on the Missouri River
